org.team5940.robot_core.modules

Interface Module

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccelerometerModule, ControlsModule, EncoderModule, GyroModule, LoggerModule, MotorSetModule, OwnableModule, PistonModule, ProcedureModule, SelectorModule, ShifterModule, TankDrivetrainModule, TestableModule, TestRunnerModule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DigitalInputSelectorModule, DoubleSolenoidPistonModule, DoubleSolenoidShifterModule, GenericControlsModule, GenericLoggerModule, NullLoggerModule, RoborioAccelerometerModule, RobotModule, SimpleModule, SimpleOwnableModule, SimpleProcedureModule, SystemLoggerModule

    public interface Module
    A module is the basic building block of robot code in BREAD's Robot Core. Anything that implements this interface should represent some part of the robot, whether a sensor, actuator, piece of code or even more complicated systems (e.g. the drivetrain). Actual functionality for a module should be given by interfaces that extend this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      This is the name for the instance of the Module implementing this interface.
      ModuleHashTable<? extends Module> getSubModules()
      This should return a NEW ModuleList containing all of the direct submodules of this, named by the return of their .getName()s.
      void initialize()
      Initializes the module if it is not already initialized.
      void setLogger(LoggerModule logger)
      Sets the Logger of this module.
      void shutDown()
      Shuts down the module if it is not already shut down.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        This is the name for the instance of the Module implementing this interface. Multiple instances of implementations of Module should never have the same name. Module names conventionally are only made of alphanumeric characters and underscores to separate groups of those (e.g. left_shifter).
        Returns:
        The name of the instance of this Module.

      • getSubModules

        ModuleHashTable<? extends Module> getSubModules()
        This should return a NEW ModuleList containing all of the direct submodules of this, named by the return of their .getName()s. This is intended for any modules that make up the lower level functionality of this module.
        Returns:
        A NEW ModuleList containing submodules, shouldn't be null even if there aren't any.

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        Initializes the module if it is not already initialized. Should generally be called after all modules have been created, but before procedures start executing. IS NOT GUARANTEED TO BE CALLED AFTER SUBMODULE INIT.

      • shutDown

        void shutDown()
        Shuts down the module if it is not already shut down. Should generally be called after procedures have finished executing.

      • setLogger

        void setLogger(LoggerModule logger)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the Logger of this module.
        Parameters:
        logger - The logger that the module should now use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the inputs == null.
